intro: Licania bracteata, commonly known as the red bract licania, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, red bracts that surround small, yellow flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Licania bracteata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
